title: Modules and Scripts
description: Move has two different types of programs: Modules_** and Scripts_. Modules are libraries that define struct types along with functions that operate on these types. Struct types define the schema of Move's global storage, and module functions define the rules for updating storage. Modules themselves are also stored in global storage. A scripts is an executable entrypoint similar to a main function in a conventional language. A script typically calls functions of a published module that perform updates to global storage. Scripts are ephemeral code snippets that are not published in global storage.
